skill.name: clinical-reports
skill.description: Write comprehensive clinical reports including case reports (CARE guidelines), diagnostic reports (radiology/pathology/lab), clinical trial reports (ICH-E3, SAE, CSR), and patient documentation (SOAP, H&P, discharge summaries). Full support with templates, regulatory compliance (HIPAA, FDA, ICH-GCP), and validation tools.
skill.summary: Generate clinical documentation for healthcare, research, and regulatory compliance including case reports, diagnostic reports, trial documentation, and patient notes.
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate clinical documentation skill with no security concerns. All 560 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown documentation content. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' detections are legitimate mentions of HIPAA compliance terms (encryption, SHA, AES) in documentation. The 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' detections are markdown code formatting syntax (`) not actual shell commands. The Python scripts are safe utilities that read files, parse regex patterns, and generate compliance reports with no command injection, credential access, or data exfiltration.

static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Markdown file contains documentation about HIPAA compliance and data security terminology. The scanner detected words like 'encryption', 'SHA', or 'AES' in medical documentation context. This is legitimate healthcare compliance documentation, not cryptographic code.
Markdown documentation file discussing HIPAA de-identification methods. Terms like 'Safe Harbor' and data protection standards are mentioned, not actual cryptographic implementations.
Markdown file uses backticks (`) for inline code formatting per Markdown syntax. No actual Ruby or shell execution occurs. This is standard markdown documentation.
References README file uses backticks for code block syntax (```bash). These are markdown formatting characters, not actual command execution. The script paths shown are documentation examples.

Python script defines HIPAA identifier patterns using regex dictionaries. The word 'pattern' containing 'ptn' was misidentified as a weak crypto algorithm. This is legitimate compliance code for detecting PHI.
The scanner detected the word 'key' in context of 'medical record number' (MRN key) or data keys, not actual cryptographic keys or certificates. No credential files are involved.
Script writes JSON compliance reports to files as output, not sensitive data exfiltration. This is standard file output for compliance reporting tools. No security risk.
Documentation mentions 'system' in context of 'SNOMED CT (Systematized Nomenclature)' or clinical systems. Not system reconnaissance. Medical terminology being documented.
URLs in documentation are reference links to CARE guidelines or regulatory resources. Not network calls or credential endpoints. Standard documentation references.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [CRITICAL] obfuscation: "[HEURISTIC] DANGEROUS COMBINATION: Code execution + Network + Credential access" at multiple:1
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: False positive heuristic triggered by markdown code formatting (backticks) combined with URL references. No actual command execution, network calls to external services, or credential access exists in this skill. Documentation-only content.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] obfuscation: "[HEURISTIC] SUSPICIOUS COMBINATION: Filesystem + Credentials + Network" at multiple:1
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: False positive heuristic. The skill reads/writes clinical report files (filesystem), may contain reference URLs (network), but contains no credentials and performs no credential access or exfiltration.

content.user_title: Write clinical reports with compliance tools
content.value_statement: Healthcare professionals need accurate clinical documentation that meets regulatory standards. This skill provides templates and validation tools for case reports, diagnostic reports, clinical trial documentation, and patient notes with HIPAA compliance checks.
actual_capabilities: Generate case reports following CARE guidelines for journal publication
Write diagnostic reports for radiology, pathology, and laboratory studies
Create clinical trial documentation including SAE reports and CSRs
Produce patient notes including SOAP notes, H&P, and discharge summaries
Validate reports for HIPAA compliance and de-identification
Apply regulatory standards including FDA, ICH-GCP, and HIPAA requirements
limitations: Does not provide medical advice or clinical decision support
Does not access external patient databases or electronic health records
Requires user to verify all clinical information for accuracy
Templates are guides and must be adapted to specific institutional requirements

use_cases.title: Publish case reports
use_cases.description: Write CARE-compliant case reports for medical journal submission with proper de-identification.

use_cases.title: Document trial data
use_cases.description: Create SAE reports and clinical study reports following ICH-E3 and regulatory requirements.

use_cases.title: Ensure compliance
use_cases.description: Validate clinical documentation for HIPAA compliance and regulatory adherence.

prompt_templates.title: Case Report Basic
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a case report following CARE guidelines for a patient with [condition]. Include abstract, introduction, patient information, clinical findings, diagnostic assessment, interventions, and discussion.

prompt_templates.title: Radiology Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a structured radiology report for [imaging type] including patient demographics, clinical indication, technique, comparison, findings, and impression.

prompt_templates.title: SAE Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a serious adverse event report for [event type] following regulatory requirements including study info, patient de-identification, event narrative, causality assessment, and expectedness determination.

prompt_templates.title: HIPAA Compliance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this clinical document for HIPAA identifier violations. Identify the 18 PHI elements that need removal and verify age compliance for patients over 89.

output_examples.input: Write a case report for a patient with atypical pneumonia presentation
output: â€¢ Title: Clear description with 'Case Report' indicator
â€¢ Abstract: Structured format covering introduction, patient concerns, diagnoses, interventions, outcomes, conclusions
â€¢ Introduction: Background on condition and case novelty
â€¢ Patient Information: De-identified demographics, medical history (no names, dates, or geographic details)
â€¢ Clinical Findings: Physical exam, vital signs, timeline of symptoms
â€¢ Diagnostic Assessment: Tests performed, results, differential diagnosis
â€¢ Interventions: Medications, dosages, procedures with reasoning
â€¢ Follow-up: Outcome, duration, patient response
â€¢ Discussion: Comparison to literature, limitations, clinical implications
â€¢ Consent Statement: Documentation of patient consent for publication

best_practices: Always verify clinical accuracy before finalizing any report
Remove all 18 HIPAA identifiers before sharing or publishing clinical documents
Obtain and document patient consent before case report publication
anti_patterns: Including identifiable patient information in reports for publication
Submitting reports without checking for HIPAA compliance
Using prohibited medical abbreviations like QD, QD, or trailing zeros in medication dosages

faq.question: What report types does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports case reports, diagnostic reports (radiology, pathology, lab), clinical trial reports (SAE, CSR), and patient documentation (SOAP, H&P, discharge summaries).

faq.question: Does this skill access patient data?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates templates and validates structure but requires users to provide clinical information. No external patient databases are accessed.

faq.question: What regulatory standards are covered?
faq.answer: HIPAA privacy rules, FDA regulations (21 CFR Part 11), ICH-GCP guidelines, CARE guidelines for case reports, and ACR/CAP standards for diagnostic reports.

faq.question: Can I use this for journal submissions?
faq.answer: Yes. Templates follow CARE, ICH-E3, and journal-specific formatting guidelines. Always verify final submission requirements with target journal.

faq.question: How does HIPAA compliance checking work?
faq.answer: The check_deidentification.py script scans for 18 PHI identifiers including names, dates, geographic data, contact info, SSN, medical record numbers, and other identifiers.

faq.question: What tools are available for validation?
faq.answer: Scripts validate CARE compliance, ICH-E3 structure, HIPAA de-identification, regulatory compliance, medical terminology, and report completeness.
